description:
Chryseobacterium taklimakanense is a species of bacteria that was first isolated from soil samples collected in the Taklimakan Desert, a large desert located in the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region of northwestern China. The Taklimakan Desert is one of the largest and driest deserts in the world.

Chryseobacterium taklimakanense is a Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, and non-motile bacterium. It is aerobic, meaning it requires oxygen for growth and metabolism. The cells are rod-shaped and yellowish in color, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Chryseobacterium.

This species was first described in 2012 by a team of researchers who identified and characterized the bacterium based on its morphological, physiological, and biochemical properties, as well as its 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis. Chryseobacterium taklimakanense is the only species within the genus Chryseobacterium that has been isolated from the Taklimakan Desert environment.

Further studies on Chryseobacterium taklimakanense may provide insights into the adaptations and survival strategies employed by microorganisms in the extreme environmental conditions of the Taklimakan Desert.
